Eric Howard Carmen (born August 11, 1949, in Cleveland, Ohio, U.S.) is an American singer, songwriter, guitarist and keyboardist.

His greatest success came in the 1970s, first as a member of The Raspberries (who scored a major hit with their song "Go All The Way"), then with his solo career, including hits like "All By Myself" and "Never Gonna Fall in Love Again".

"Make Me Lose Control" is the title of a 1988 single written and performed by the singer-songwriter Eric Carmen.

Released a few months after the success of "Hungry Eyes", Carmen&#039;s song from the film Dirty Dancing which peaked at #4 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart, "Make Me Lose Control" also reached the Top 5 on the Hot 100, topping out at #3. On the Sales chart, the song spent a week at #1; on the Airplay chart, it made #4. The song spent 13 weeks in the Top 40. In addition, "Make Me Lose Control" spent three weeks at #1 on the adult contemporary chart, the singer&#039;s second song to do so (following "Never Gonna Fall in Love Again" from 1976). Although "Make Me Lose Control" did not originally appear on any of Carmen&#039;s studio albums, the song would later surface on various "greatest hits" releases.
